answers.answer: talk to your obgyn dr and no i dont think you have hiv

I tested NEGATIVE!!  I don't think I really had another yeast infection.  My symptoms disappeared when I found out I was negative.  I am a firm believer that the mind can convince your body of symptoms that are not really there.
The mind is very capable of making the body physically ill. Grats on your Neg test

question: I am the one who was worried about my ex-husband's risk-taking behavior.  Everyone seems to think I have a very, very low risk of being HIV +.  I am STILL anxiously waiting for my results.  I am extra worried because I have had a vaginal yeast infection that has been coming and going for at least two months.  It goes away with treatment and comes back about a week later.  I have an appointment with my OB-GYN in a couple weeks.  I know that's definately what it is and nothing else.  I have not had sex with anybody in 2 years.  I have read that sometimes the first and only sign of HIV infection in women is a recurrent vaginal yeast infection.  Of course, there could be other causes, like the medication I am using doesn't work on the particular yeast I have or I have a family history of diabetes.  It could be diabetes.  I have been eating A LOT more sugar than normal over the holidays.  What does everyone think?  Do you think it's my sign of HIV or something else?I haven't had any other illness or any swollen lymph nodes or anything else.
title: yeast infections and HIV
